result.markdown: --- title: "Provider API" editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} Provider API Docs Dataset Search ``` ::: ::: This site provides access to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services official data that are used on the **Medicare Care Compare** website and directories. * [Home](https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/) * [About](https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/about) ### Rate Limit The **Provider Data Catalog API** currently limits each batch of results to a maximum of **2,000** entries. To retrieve datasets larger than this threshold, you must execute multiple requests, incrementing the offset each time to paginate through results: 1. Fetch the first 2000 results: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ownership0 <- httr2::url_parse( base_url = "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/", url = "api/1/datastore/query/7t8x-u3ir/0") |> httr2::url_modify_query( offset = 0, size = 2000) |> httr2::url_build() |> httr2::request() |> httr2::req_perform() |> httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE) ownership0$query ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $offset [1] 0 $size [1] "2000" $resources id alias 1 e7fce918-0873-519f-80ae-818e386299d1 t $limit [1] 2000 $count [1] TRUE $results [1] TRUE $schema [1] TRUE $keys [1] TRUE $format [1] "json" $rowIds [1] FALSE $properties [1] "cms_certification_number_ccn" "provider_name" [3] "address_line_1" "address_line_2" [5] "citytown" "state" [7] "zip_code" "countyparish" [9] "telephone_number" "cms_region" [11] "ownership_type" "certification_date" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ownership0$count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1229 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ownership0$results |> tibble() |> glimpse() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 1,229 Columns: 12 $ cms_certification_number_ccn "013025", "013028", "013029", "013030", "… $ provider_name "ENCOMPASS HEALTH LAKESHORE REHABILITATIO… $ address_line_1 "3800 RIDGEWAY DRIVE", "4465 NARROW LANE … $ address_line_2 "-", "-", "-", "-", "-", "-", "-", "-", "… $ citytown "BIRMINGHAM", "MONTGOMERY", "HUNTSVILLE",… $ state "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL", "AL",… $ zip_code "35209", "36116", "35811", "36301", "3512… $ countyparish "Jefferson", "Montgomery", "Madison", "Ho… $ telephone_number "(205) 868-2000", "(334) 284-7821", "(205… $ cms_region "4", "4", "4", "4", "4", "4", "4", "4", "… $ ownership_type "For profit", "For profit", "For profit",… $ certification_date "10/01/1983", "05/11/1987", "06/04/1987",… ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: 2. Fetch the next 2000 results (2001-4000): ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ownership1 <- httr2::url_parse( base_url = "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/", url = "7t8x-u3ir/0") |> httr2::url_modify_query( offset = 2001, size = 4000) |> httr2::url_build() |> httr2::request() |> httr2::req_perform() |> httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE) ownership1$query ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $offset [1] 2001 $size [1] "4000" $resources id alias 1 e7fce918-0873-519f-80ae-818e386299d1 t $limit [1] 2000 $count [1] TRUE $results [1] TRUE $schema [1] TRUE $keys [1] TRUE $format [1] "json" $rowIds [1] FALSE $properties [1] "cms_certification_number_ccn" "provider_name" [3] "address_line_1" "address_line_2" [5] "citytown" "state" [7] "zip_code" "countyparish" [9] "telephone_number" "cms_region" [11] "ownership_type" "certification_date" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ownership1$count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1229 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ownership1$results |> tibble() |> glimpse() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 0 Columns: 1 $ `ownership1$results` list() ``` ::: ::: Continue incrementing the offset by 2,000 for each subsequent batch. When retrieving large datasets, consider pacing your requests to avoid overwhelming your system with data and to allow for graceful error handling. Depending on the volume of data and your application's capabilities, consider implementing a back-off strategy if errors occur. ### Stars/Ratings CMS's **Five-Star Quality Rating System** is designed to help users compare the overall quality of care across different healthcare providers. Access these ratings by referring to the associated column names: * __Nursing Home__: `overall_rating` * __Hospitals__: `hospital_overall_rating` * __Dialysis__: `five_star` * __Hospice__: `star_rating` * __Home Health__: `quality_of_patient_care_star_rating` For example, the query for [**Nursing Home**](https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/dataset/4pq5-n9py) facilities with _less than_ a 5-star overall rating is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} nhome0 <- httr2::url_parse( base_url = "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/", url = "4pq5-n9py/0") |> httr2::url_modify_query( `conditions[0][property]` = "overall_rating", `conditions[0][value]` = 5, `conditions[0][operator]` = "<", offset = 0, limit = 2000) |> httr2::url_build() |> httr2::request() |> httr2::req_perform() |> httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE) nhome0$query ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $conditions property value operator 1 overall_rating 5 < $offset [1] Conditions Use the __Datastore Query Endpoint__ (`datastore/query/{datasetID}/{index}`). It takes two arguments: the __`datasetID`__, which does not change between data refreshes, and the distribution's __`index`__, which will _always_ be `0`. For example, to return the first 500 results (the default) of a dataset with an overall rating of 5: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} httr2::url_parse( base_url = "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/", url = "4pq5-n9py/0") |> httr2::url_modify_query( `conditions[0][property]` = "overall_rating", `conditions[0][value]` = 5, `conditions[0][operator]` = "=", offset = 0, limit = 500) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/4pq5-n9py/0?conditions%5B0%5D%5Bproperty%5D=overall_rating&conditions%5B0%5D%5Bvalue%5D=5&conditions%5B0%5D%5Boperator%5D=%3D&offset=0&limit=500 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • scheme: https ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • hostname: data.cms.gov ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • path: /provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/4pq5-n9py/0 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • query: ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • conditions[0][property]: overall_rating ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • conditions[0][value]: 5 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • conditions[0][operator]: %3D ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • offset: 0 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` • limit: 500 ``` ::: ::: More complex queries can be created in JSON and converted to an HTTP query string using the [JSON Query to String](https://www.convertonline.io/convert/json-to-query-string) tool. For example, to return the `cms_certification_number_ccn` and `overall_rating` columns with a rating greater than 3, use the following JSON: ```{.json} { "properties": [ "cms_certification_number_ccn", "overall_rating" ], "conditions": [ { "property":"overall_rating", "value": "3", "operator": ">" } ] } ``` This converts to a query string of: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} nhomegt3 <- httr2::url_parse( base_url = "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/", url = "4pq5-n9py/0") |> httr2::url_modify_query( `properties[]` = "state", `properties[]` = "overall_rating", `conditions[0][property]` = "overall_rating", `conditions[0][value]` = 3, `conditions[0][operator]` = ">", offset = 0, limit = 2000) |> httr2::url_build() |> httr2::request() |> httr2::req_perform() |> httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE) nhomegt3$query ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $properties [1] "state" "overall_rating" $conditions property value operator 1 overall_rating 3 > $offset [1] 0 $limit [1] 2000 $resources id alias 1 f93da3a3-400b-5efe-960d-c1d72b1d4f65 t $count [1] TRUE $results [1] TRUE $schema [1] TRUE $keys [1] TRUE $format [1] "json" $rowIds [1] FALSE ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} nhomegt3$count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 5174 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} nhomegt3$results |> tibble() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # endpoint. For example, if you filter by _"Dialysis facilities"_ tagged with _"Linking Quality to Payment"_ and select 25 results per page, the query string produced is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x <- resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE) x$facets |> tibble() |> mutate(across(where(is.character), ~ na_if(.x, ""))) |> remove_all_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 221 × 3 9189f27bb8ab7a4ff8919bdc682bf79a, text/csv, text/csv, source, local_url, 1729022725, 1729022725, NA, NA ``` ::: ::: ::: callout ## Differences ### __Metastore__ vs. __Datastore__ * __Datastore__ * Data from the data files (CSVs) * __Metastore__ * Metadata from the `data.json` file * `title`, `last_updated`, `release_date`, `keywords`, etc. Think of the __Metastore__ as the library index that helps you find the right book (`dataset`), and the __Datastore__ as the book itself. ### __Dataset__ vs. __Distribution__ * __Distribution__ * Unique identifier of the _Datastore_ * Specific to a particular CSV data import * Changes with every data refresh * __Dataset__ * Unique identifier of the _Dataset_ * Comes from the data.json file * Appears as part of the URL in the PDC site * Does not change between data refreshes If you have been using the `datastore/sql` or `datastore/query/{distributionId}` endpoints, consider switching to the `datastore/query/{datasetID}/{index}` endpoint instead. The `datasetID` does not change between refreshes, and, currently, all **Provider Data Catalog** datasets only have a single resource, so the `index` will _always_ be `0`. For example, search the [Long Term Care Hospital dataset](https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/dataset/5zdx-ny2x) with: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/5zdx-ny2x/0" ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/datastore/query/5zdx-ny2x/0" ``` ::: ::: Distribution IDs change with every dataset update, so it is better to use APIs with the Dataset ID and the index of the distribution. If you still need the current distribution ID, you can access it through the metadata API, under `distribution -> identifier`: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/metastore/schemas/dataset/items/[datasetID]?show-reference-ids" ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/api/1/metastore/schemas/dataset/items/[datasetID]?show-reference-ids" ``` ::: ::: ::: --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
